chart module¶

class chart.Chart(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, title: str, id: int)¶

Bases: object

Class contains loaded time series data in form of charts.

__ax = None¶

Axes of the chart.

__df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame = None¶

Data frame of loaded signal.

__figure: matplotlib.backends.backend_tkagg.FigureCanvasTkAgg = None¶

Canvas of the chart.

__id: int = 0¶

ID of the chart.

__title: str = ''¶

Title of the chart.

displayChart(display: tkinter.ttk.Frame, moduleDisplayer)¶

Displays chart on screen.

Parameters

  • display – GUI component where chart should be displayed.

  • moduleDisplayer – Method called in-line, that applies patches on chart from all active time series modules.

exportChart(filename: str)¶

Exports chart as .png file to specified destination.

Parameters

filename – Directory where canvas should be saved.

Returns data frame of loaded signal.

Returns

Data frame of loaded signal.

Returns ID of the chart.

Returns

ID of the chart.

Returns title of the chart.

Title of the chart.

Sets title of the chart.

Parameters

title – New title of the chart.

dataGenerator module¶

class dataGenerator.SignalGenerator¶

Bases: object

Class containing sample time series signal.

__dataY = None¶

Generated signal.

__genCps = None¶

Generated change point indexes.

__genMeans = None¶

Means in area between change points, before applying noise.

__genSpreads = None¶

Gaussian noise scale in area between change points.

applyPatchesToChart(ax)¶

Visualizes change points on charts’ axes.

Parameters

ax – Chart’s axes

generateSignal(samples, cpCount, mean, meanSpread, noiseScale, noiseScaleSpread)¶

Generates signal based on parameters. Data is stored inside the class.

Parameters

  • samples – Number of samples (data length) in generated signal.

  • cpCount – Number of change points in generated signal

  • mean – Mean of all data in generated signal

  • meanSpread – Spread of mean of all data in generated signal

  • noiseScale – Gaussian noise scale in areas between change points in generated signal.

  • noiseScaleSpread – Spread of gaussian noise scale in areas between change points in generated signal.

getGeneratedSignalProperties() → tuple¶

Returns properties of generated signal.

Returns

Properties of generated signal.

getSignal() → list¶

Returns generated signal.

Returns

Generated signal.

Checks if value is float value.

Parameters

val – Value to check.

Returns

If val meets requirements. Rollbacks operation if false.

Parameters

val – Value to check.

Returns

If val meets requirements. Rollbacks operation if false.

Checks if value is positive (or zero) float value.

Parameters

val – Value to check.

Returns

If val meets requirements. Rollbacks operation if false.

entryvalidators.validate_int_pos(val)¶

Checks 0 :param val: Value to check. :returns: If val meets requirements. Rollbacks operation if false.

rupturesefficiency module¶

class rupturesefficiency.RupturesEfficiency¶

Bases: object

Class evaluating efficiency of implemented change point detection algorithms. It has no gui, it’s intended to be displayed in command prompt.

evaluate(settrue: list, seteval: list, m: float) → tuple¶

Evaluates change point detection results.

Parameters

  • settrue – Set of true change points.

  • seteval – Set of estimated change points.

  • m – Precision’s and recall’s margin argument.

Returns

User input.

f = None¶

Handle to file, where results should be stored.

outputCPs(header: str, res: list)¶

Writes results of change point detection algorithms in single iteration.

Parameters

  • header – Display that helps the user read final file.

  • res – List of change points

outputSummary(header: str, eval: rupturesefficiency.RupturesEvaluations)¶

Writes results of evaluation metrics

Parameters

  • header – Display that helps the user read final file.

  • eval – Class concatenating evaluations of change point finding algorithms.

provideFloat(display: str) → float¶

Asks user for input in form of float value.

Parameters

display – Display that helps the user what he is about to put.

provideFromMap(display: str, dict: map) → str¶

Asks user for input in form of single occurence from the map.

Parameters

  • display – Display that helps the user what he is about to put.

  • dict – Map with possible values.

Returns

User input.

providePositiveBool(display: str) → bool¶

Asks user for input in form of bool value.

Parameters

display – Display that helps the user what he is about to put.

Returns

User input.

providePositiveFloat(display: str) → float¶

Asks user for input in form of positive float value.

Parameters

display – Display that helps the user what he is about to put.

Returns

User input.

providePositiveFloatOrZero(display: str) → float¶

Asks user for input in form of positive float (or zero) value.

Parameters

display – Display that helps the user what he is about to put.

Returns

User input.

providePositiveInt(display: str) → int¶

Asks user for input in form of positive int value.

Parameters

display – Display that helps the user what he is about to put.

Returns

User input.

run()¶

Runs evaluation of efficiency of implemented change point detection algorithms.

class rupturesefficiency.RupturesEvaluations¶

Bases: object

Class concatenating evaluations of change point finding algorithms.

appendAll(*args)¶

Adds a record to metrics arrays

Parameters

args – Array of metrics to add.

hs = None¶

List of Hausdorff Metrics results.

l = None¶

Estimated:True change point count ratio

ps = None¶

List of Precision Metrics results.

ris = None¶

List of Rand index Metrics results.

rs = None¶

List of Recall Metrics results.

tsmodules.ruptureeval module¶

class tsmodules.ruptureeval.RupturesEvaluation(_TSModule__name)¶

Bases: tsmodules.basemod.TSModule

Class implementing change point detection evaluation in time series modules. Evaluations include Hausdorff metric, rand index, precision and recall.

__argError()¶

Method displayed when sets have been wrongly filled.

__outvarEstset = None¶

Second (predicted) set of change point indexes.

__outvarMargin = None¶

Margin value used to calculate true positives.

__outvarOrigset = None¶

First (original) set of change point indexes.

Parameters

  • ax – Reference to plot’s axes.

  • plotdf – Data frame with original signal.

Bases: tsmodules.rupturesmods.RupturesModule

calculateChangePoints(signal) → list¶

Calculates change point indexes.

Parameters

class tsmodules.rupturesmods.RupturesModule(name)¶

Bases: tsmodules.basemod.TSModule

Class implementing change point detection algorithms in time series modules.

__dictCost = None¶

Dictionary of cost functions, that can be used to in change point detection algorithms.

__outvarCPoints = None¶

How many change points should be found in algorithm.

__outvarCPointsConsider = None¶

If number of change points is known, number of change points is taken as an argument instead of penalty value in change point detection algorithms.

__outvarCost = None¶

Chosen cost function, that can be used to in change point detection algorithms.

__outvarPenalty = None¶

Linear penalty parameter. Value determines how many change points might detection algorithms find.

buildConfig(section: tkinter.ttk.Frame)¶

Provides GUI elements for time series module configuration.

Parameters

section – GUI component where module configuration should be displayed.

buildConfigAlgoParams(section: tkinter.ttk.Frame)¶

Method meant to be overwritten. Provides GUI elements for specific change point detection algorithms’ parameters.

Parameters

section – GUI component where specific parameters should be displayed.

calculateChangePoints(signal) → list¶

Method meant to be overwritten. Calculates change point indexes.

Parameters

signal – Time series data.

Returns

Indexes of change points.

displayModule(ax, plotdf: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame)¶

Processes analyzing module and displays results on chart’s axes.

Parameters

  • ax – Reference to plot’s axes.

  • plotdf – Data frame with original signal.

shouldConsiderCPoints() → bool¶

Returns the indicator if number of change should be taken as an argument instead of penalty value in change point detection algorithms.

The indicator if number of change should be taken as an argument instead of penalty value in change point detection algorithms.
